question_text: Which of the following best describes mail authentication in the context of DNS security?
answer_options: It encrypts email content during transmission
It uses DNS-based mechanisms to validate sender identity and message integrity
It blocks all incoming mail from unknown IP addresses
It enables POP3 and IMAP login tracking
correct_answer: It uses DNS-based mechanisms to validate sender identity and message integrity
explanation: Mail authentication includes SPF, DKIM, and DMARC â€” all of which rely on DNS records to confirm legitimate senders and prevent forgery.
